intro: Urophyllum peltistigma, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in moist, disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats. Urophyllum peltistigma is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
